Package ptolemy.domains.modal.kernel

Interface RefinementActor

All Superinterfaces:
ptolemy.actor.Actor, ptolemy.actor.Executable, ptolemy.actor.Initializable, ptolemy.kernel.util.Nameable, ptolemy.actor.TypedActor
All Known Implementing Classes:
ModalController, ModalRefinement, Refinement, TransitionRefinement
public interface RefinementActor
extends ptolemy.actor.TypedActor
An interface for actors that act as refinements of states in FSMs or events in Ptera models.
Since:
Ptolemy II 8.0
Version:
$Id: RefinementActor.java 57046 2010-01-27 23:35:53Z cxh $
Author:
Thomas Huining Feng

  • Method Details

    • addRefinement

      void addRefinement​(State state, java.lang.String name, ptolemy.kernel.Entity template, java.lang.String className, Configuration configuration) throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Create a refinement for the given state.
      Parameters:
      state - The state that will contain the new refinement.
      name - The name of the composite entity that stores the refinement.
      template - The template used to create the refinement, or null if template is not used.
      className - The class name for the refinement, which is used when template is null.
      configuration - The configuration that is used to open the refinement (as a look-inside action) after it is created, or null if it is not needed to open the refinement.
      Throws:
      ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If error occurs while creating the refinement.

    • getRefinedState

      State getRefinedState() throws ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException
      Return the state (or event, which subclasses state) that this actor refines.
      Returns:
      The state or event that this actor refines.
      Throws:
      ptolemy.kernel.util.IllegalActionException - If thrown while trying to find the refined state or event.

    • setMirrorDisable

      void setMirrorDisable​(int disable)
      Control whether adding a port should be mirrored in the modal model and the mode controller.
      Parameters:
      disable - 0 if mirroring should occur, -1 if mirroring should not occur downwards in the hierarchy, 1 if mirroring should not occur upwards in the hierarchy.
